gurmukhi: ਧਰਧਰ ਲੌ ਨਰ ਚੀਨੇ ॥ ਸੁਖ ਦੈ ਦੁਖ ਬਿਨ ਕੀਨੇ ॥੭੦੪॥
transliteration: Dhardhar Lau Nar Cheene|| Soukh Dai Doukh Bin Keene||704||
translation: He identified the people on the earth and comforted them, removing their agony.704.

gurmukhi: ਅਰ ਹਰ ਨਰ ਕਰ ਜਾਨੇ ॥ ਦੁਖ ਹਰ ਸੁਖ ਕਰ ਮਾਨੇ ॥
transliteration: Ar Har Nar Kar Jaane|| Doukh Har Souch Kar Maane||
translation: All the people considered him as the destroyer of enemies, remover of sufferings and the giver of comforts;

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰ ਧਰ ਨਰ ਬਰਸੇ ਹੈ ॥ ਰੂਪ ਅਨੂਪ ਅਭੈ ਹੈ ॥੭੦੫॥
transliteration: Pur Dhar Nar Barse Hai|| Roop Anoop Abhai Hai||705||
translation: All the city of Ayodhya is living in comfort because of his unique personality and the fearless blessings.705.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਭੂ ਹੈ ॥ ਅਜੂ ਹੈ ॥ ਅਜੈ ਹੈ ॥ ਅਭੈ ਹੈ ॥੭੦੬॥
transliteration: Prabhoo Hai|| Ajoo Hai|| Abhai Hai||706||
translation: That Ram is God, Infinite, Unconquerable and Fearless.706.

gurmukhi: ਅਜਾ ਹੈ ॥ ਅਤਾ ਹੈ ॥ ਅਲੈ ਹੈ ॥ ਅਜੈ ਹੈ ॥੭੦੭॥
transliteration: Ajaa Hai|| Ataa Hai|| Alai Hai|| Ajai Hai||707||
translation: He is the Lord of nature, he is Purusha, he is the whole world and higher Brahman.707.

gurmukhi: ਬੁਲਯੋ ਚਤ੍ਰ ਭ੍ਰਾਤੰ ਸੁਮਿਤ੍ਰਾ ਕੁਮਾਰੰ ॥ ਕਰਯੋ ਮਾਥੁਰੇਸੰ ਤਿਸੇ ਰਾਵਣਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Bulyo Chatra Bhraatan Soumitraa Koumaaran|| Daryo Maathuresan Tise Raavanaaran||
translation: One day Ram sent for the son of Sumitra and said to him :

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ੲੇਕ ਦੲੀਤੰ ਲਵੰ ੳੁਗ੍ਰ ਤੇਜੰ ॥ ਦਯੋ ਤਾਹਿ ਅੱਪੰ ਸਿਵੰ ਸੂਲ ਭੇਜੰ ॥੭੦੮॥
transliteration: Tahaan Ek Daeetan Lavan Ougra Tejan|| Dayo Taah(i) Appan Sivan Sool Bhejan||708||
translation: In a distant land there lives a huge demon named Lavan, who has got the trident of Shiva,708.

gurmukhi: ਪਠਯੋ ਤੀਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਦੀਯੋ ੲੇਕ ਰਾਮੰ ॥ ਮਹਾਂ ਜੁੱਧ ਮਾਲੀ ਮਹਾਂ ਧਰਮ ਧਾਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Pathyo Teer Mantran Deeyo Ek Ramannd|| Mahaan Juddh Maalimahaan Dharam Dhaamannd||
translation: Ram gave him an arrow after reciting a mantra which was a great weapon from Ram, the abode of Dharma.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵੰ ਸੂਲ ਹੀਣੰ ਜਵੈ ਸੱਤ੍ਰ ਜਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਤਬੈ ਸੰਗਿ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਮਹਾਂ ਜੁੱਧ ਠਾਨਯੋ ॥੭੦੯॥
transliteration: Sivan Sool Heenan Javai Sattra Jaanyo|| Tabai San(i) Taa Kai Mahaan Juddh Thaanyo||709||
translation: Ram said to him “When you see the enemy without the trident of Shiva, then wage a war with him.”709.

gurmukhi: ਲਯੋ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਤੀਰੰ ਚਲਯੋ ਨਿਅਾੲਿ ਸੀਸੰ ॥ ਤ੍ਰਿਪੁਰ ਜੁੱਧ ਜੇਤਾ ਚਲਯੋ ਜਾਣ ੲੀਸੰ ॥
transliteration: Layo Mantra Tderan Chadyo Niaae|| Tripur Juddhjetaa Chadyo Jaan Eesan||
translation: Shatrughan taking that charmed arrows and bowing his head started for his errand and it seemed that he was going as conquerer of the three worlds;

gurmukhi: ਲਖਯੋ ਸੂਲ ਹੀਣੰ ਰਿਪੰ ਜੳੁਣ ਕਾਲੰ ॥ ਤਬੈ ਕੋਪ ਮੰਡਯੋ ਰਣੰ ਬਿਕਰਾਲੰ ॥੭੧੦॥
transliteration: Lakhyo Sool Heenan Ripan Jaoun Kaalan|| Tabai Kop Mandyo Ranan Bikraalan||710||
translation: When he saw the enemy without the trident of Shiva, then finding an opportunity, he furiously began to wage war with him.710.

gurmukhi: ਭਜੈ ਘਾੲਿ ਖਾਯੰ ਅਘਾਯੰਤ ਸੂਰੰ ॥ ਹਸੇ ਕੰਕ ਬੰਕੰ ਘੁਮੀ ਗੈਣ ਹੂਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhajai Ghaae Khaayan Aghaayant Sooran || Hase Kank Bankan Ghounmigadn Hooran||
translation: After getting wounded the warriors began to run away and the crows began to caw o seeing the corpse. The heavenly damsels began to wander in the sky;
